channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Drain cover missing, 26th July
item.description:
Dangerous. Drain cover is missing so people could step in it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Floral Street, Bloomsbury, London

item.title: Fly tipping commercial waste in residental bins. White van EG68 WOV, 26th July
item.description:
2 guys turning up and fly tipping commercial waste in residential bin area. Bins are unsecured so appears to be an ongoing problem. White van license plate EG68 WOV. Too far away for me to take a picture
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maidstone Road, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 226 Grafton Road/Cressfield Close, 26th July
item.description:
The CCTV which has recently been replaced (was missing for 3 months) has been vandalised again. The camera is pointing up to the sky and not at the road. So the no entry to cars is not being enforced. I experienced a vehicle driving through the no entry today. I have also raised this issue with my local councillor.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Cressfield Close, Gospel Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Lime Bike, 26th July

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birkbeck Road, Penge, London

item.title: Fly tipping and general rubbish, 26th July
item.description:
People often dump their rubbish and fly tio outside my home. This is often by Zip Van users. I have reported the problem to the company Zip Car numerous times with no resolution. Today I have a mattress and general rubbish lying around the pavement/street. Please could you kindly remove the items as it is bringing down my mood and general upkeep of the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arthurdon Road, Ladywell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pile of household and larger items outsode 224 Traflagar Road, 26th July
item.description:
Flat occupants continue to use the street outside as their personal rubbish tip, for both household rubbish bags and larger dumped items. Today the pile is so large it is blocking the pavement and encroaching on nearby businesses. Why is nothing done to fine / prosecute them?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
